q: Who is eligible to participate in HackHive?
a: The event is open to students currently pursuing a Bachelor's Degree (Undergraduate) or Diploma Programs at a recognized institution.

q: What is the required team size?
a: Each team must consist of 3 to 4 members only.

q: When will the Problem Statements and Domains be released?
a: All Domains and Problem Statements will be released on 30th January 2026.

q: What is the deadline for Round 1 submission?
a: The Project Proposal PPT submission deadline for the Online Shortlisting Round is 23rd February 2026, 11:00 AM.

q: How many teams will be shortlisted for the Final Round?
a: A total of 27 teams will be shortlisted, which is 3 teams per problem statement.

q: When and where is the Offline Final Hackathon Round (Round 2)?
a: Round 2 will be held on 6th March 2026 at the Datta Meghe College of Engineering, Airoli, and will last for 12 hours.
Yes, there is a mandatory entry fee of ₹300 per team, applicable only for teams selected for the Offline Final Round (Round 2).

q: What is the total prize pool?
a: The total prize pool for HackHive is ₹27,000.

q: How will the winners be selected?
a: Winners will be selected domain-wise, with 2 winning teams per domain, making a total of 6 winning teams.

q: Can our team members change between rounds?
a: No, team members must remain the same for both the Online Shortlisting Round (Round 1) and the Offline Final Hackathon Round (Round 2).
